summary_points: 1. On May 27, 2025, Builders FirstSource, Inc. stockholders approved amendments to declassify the Board of Directors and limit the liability of certain officers.
2. At the 2025 annual meeting, 91.01% of voting power was represented, with  Proposal No. 5 (removing limits on the Board's size) failing to receive approval.

3. The amendments to the Certificate of Incorporation and Bylaws, effective May 27, 2025, remove the staggered board structure, potentially impacting future board composition and responsiveness to shareholder concerns.

1. EPAM Systems, Inc. stockholders approved a new long-term incentive plan (the "2025 Plan") on May 22, 2025, replacing the 2015 plan and reserving up to 2,500,000 shares of common stock for issuance.

2.  Stockholder votes at the annual meeting (May 22, 2025) to declassify the board, reduce supermajority voting requirements, and opt out of Section 203 of the Delaware General Corporation Law all passed with substantial majorities exceeding 90% of votes cast.

3.  A stockholder proposal requesting a simple majority vote for board actions to eliminate supermajority voting requirements received 24,205,827 votes for and 22,062,289 votes against, and the board will examine these results.

1. General Mills announced a global transformation initiative on May 20, 2025, expecting to incur total charges of approximately $130 million, $120 million of which will be cash, by the end of fiscal 2028.
2.  Approximately $70 million of the anticipated $130 million in charges are expected to be recorded in the fourth quarter of fiscal 2025, primarily as severance expenses.
3. The estimated costs and timing are subject to assumptions, and actual results may differ;  additional unforeseen charges may arise from the transformation initiative.
1. At Kenvue Inc.'s 2025 Annual Meeting of Shareholders on May 22, 2025, all 13 director nominees were elected to the Board of Directors.

2.  Shareholder approval, on a non-binding advisory basis, was given to the compensation of Kenvue Inc.'s named executive officers, with 1,675,645,180 votes for, 49,702,881 against, and 1,746,444 abstentions.
3. PricewaterhouseCoopers LLP was ratified as Kenvue Inc.'s independent registered public accounting firm for 2025.
1. Motorola Solutions is acquiring Silvus Technologies for $4.4 billion, with a potential additional $600 million earnout.
2. The acquisition is predicted to increase Motorola's non-GAAP EPS within a year of closing (predicted as of May 27, 2025).
3. Regulatory approvals are required before the acquisition can be completed.

1. Travelers Companies, Inc. announced on May 27, 2025, a definitive agreement to sell its Canadian personal and majority commercial insurance businesses to Definity Financial Corporation for approximately US$2.4 billion.
2. The transaction, expected to close in the first quarter of 2026, is anticipated to be slightly accretive to Travelers' earnings per share in the next several years.
3.  Travelers plans to use approximately US$0.7 billion of the net proceeds for share repurchases in 2026.
1. At EOG Resources Inc.'s 2025 Annual Meeting (held May 21, 2025), all eight director nominees were elected, with between 94.99% and 97.15% of shares voted in favor.
2.  The appointment of Deloitte & Touche LLP as EOG's auditors for the year ending December 31, 2025, was ratified with 97.22% of shares voted in favor.
3. The compensation of EOG's named executive officers received approval from 96.65% of the votes cast in a non-binding advisory vote at the 2025 Annual Meeting.

1. On May 22, 2025, ServiceNow, Inc. shareholders approved amendments to the company's Certificate of Incorporation, eliminating supermajority voting provisions and incorporating Delaware law provisions regarding officer exculpation.
2.  At the Annual Meeting on May 22, 2025, shareholder votes on executive compensation were overwhelmingly in favor (146,569,886 shares for vs. 18,440,159 against).
3. Shareholder proposals regarding the right to cure nomination defects and removing the one-year holding period requirement for calling a special meeting were rejected.
1. Jeffrey Braun, Allegion plc's Senior Vice President and General Counsel, will transition to Senior Vice President and Advisory Counsel on June 16, 2025, before retiring on June 30, 2025.
2.  This 8-K filing, dated May 27, 2025, reports on events that occurred on May 20, 2025.
3. No specific future impacts or risks are quantified in this section of the filing.

1. Pinnacle West Capital Corporation and Arizona Public Service Company projected long-term EPS growth of 5-7% through 2028 as of May 27, 2025,  based on reduced regulatory lag and economic development.
2.  The May 27, 2025, Form 8-K filing contained additional undisclosed financial projections beyond the previously announced 5-7% EPS growth.
3. As of December 31, 2024, the company held $26 billion in consolidated assets and had a $9.64 billion market capitalization.

1. On May 26, 2025, Soon Chai Gooi, Senior Vice President of Order Fulfillment and Digital Operations, announced his retirement, effective immediately,  with Ingrid Estrada appointed as his successor.
2.  Mr. Gooi had been with the company since August 2014.
3. Mr. Gooi's departure is for personal reasons and not due to any disagreement with Keysight Technologies, Inc.
1. On May 22, 2025, Lennox International Inc. elected Tracy A. Embree to its Board of Directors, effective June 1, 2025, with a term expiring in 2028.
2. At the May 22, 2025 annual meeting, the advisory vote to approve the compensation of named executive officers received approximately 93% approval from stockholders.
3. Ms. Embree's compensation will include an annual retainer of $105,000 and approximately $155,000 in annual equity compensation.

1. Cincinnati Financial Corporation experienced a significant year-over-year decline in EPS from $4.78 in 1Q24 to -$0.57 in 1Q25, primarily due to decreased equity security value and increased catastrophe losses.
2.  Property and casualty net written premiums grew 11% year-to-date (through March 31, 2025), exceeding the projected 7% full-year 2025 industry average.
3.  The company's 1Q25 Value Creation Ratio was -0.5%, significantly below their projected 10-13% average for the next five years (2025-2030).
1. Salesforce, Inc. announced on May 27, 2025, a definitive agreement to acquire Informatica Inc. for approximately $8 billion.

2. The acquisition is expected to be accretive to Salesforce's non-GAAP operating margin, non-GAAP earnings per share, and free cash flow starting in the second year after the transaction's anticipated close in early fiscal year 2027.

3.  The acquisition's success is subject to regulatory approvals and other customary closing conditions; failure to obtain these could result in termination of the agreement, potentially requiring payment of a termination fee.

1. Kevin Thornal was appointed Group President, Global Businesses and the Americas of Zimmer Biomet Holdings, Inc., effective July 1, 2025, overseeing the Americas commercial organization and leading business strategy for several global units.

2.  Mr. Thornal's initial annual base salary will be $850,000, and his target annual bonus opportunity for 2025 (prorated) will be 100% of his base salary, plus approximately $5,300,000 in estimated equity awards.

3. Mr. Thornal's employment is at-will, but he has a Change in Control Severance Agreement providing significant severance benefits if his employment is terminated following a change in control (as defined in the agreement).
1. AutoZone's third-quarter (ended May 10, 2025) total company same-store sales increased by 5.4%, while domestic same-store sales rose by 5.0%.
2. Diluted earnings per share decreased by 3.6% year-over-year to $35.36 in the third quarter of fiscal year 2025.

3.  AutoZone repurchased 70,000 shares of its common stock for a total investment of $250.3 million during the third quarter of fiscal year 2025, leaving $1.1 billion remaining under its current share repurchase authorization.
1. Invesco Ltd. shareholders elected all nominated board members on May 23, 2025, with significant broker non-votes (36,120,192 for each director).
2.  Invesco Ltd. is implementing a hybrid investment platform using both State Street and Blackrock's technology throughout 2025 and 2026.
3. This dual-platform migration is not expected to affect Invesco Ltd.'s previously announced 2025 expense guidance.
1. Mondelez International, Inc. implemented a new severance plan for key executives on May 20, 2025, offering benefits including 12 months' base salary and pro-rated bonuses.

2. At the annual shareholder meeting on May 21, 2025, 86.8% of outstanding Class A Common Stock was represented, with  high approval rates for director elections and the Global Employee Stock Purchase Matching Plan.

3. Shareholder proposals regarding supplier code of conduct, flexible plastic packaging, climate lobbying, human rights policy assessment, and recycled content claims were all rejected at the May 21, 2025, shareholder meeting.
